sen.j: 与祢（よね、天正8年（1580年） - 天正13年11月29日 (旧暦)（1586年1月18日））は、安土桃山時代の武将山内一豊の長女にして、唯一の実子。
sen.e: Yone (1580 - January 18, 1586) was the eldest daughter of Kazutoyo YAMAUCHI, a Japanese military commander who lived during the Azuchi-Momoyama period, and she was Kazutoyo's only biological child.
Yone (1580 - January 18, 1586) was the eldest daughter of Kazutoyo YAMAUCHI, a Japanese military commander who lived during the Azuchi-Momoyama period, and she was Kazutoyo's only biological child.
Yone (1580 - January 18, 1586) was the eldest daughter of Kazutoyo YAMAUCHI, a Japanese military commander who lived during the Azuchi-Momoyama period, and she was Kazutoyo's only biological child.

sen.j: 天正8年（1580年）、山内一豊とその正室の見性院 (山内一豊室)との長女として近江国で生まれる。
sen.e: She was born in Omi Province in 1580, as the eldest daughter of Kazutoyo YAMAUCHI and his lawful wife Kenshoin.
sen.cmt: 原文に「見性院 (山内一豊室)」とありますが、リンク先の用語と混ざっているようです。ウェブを確認し「見性院」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: She was born in Omi Province in 1580, as the eldest daughter of Kazutoyo YAMAUCHI and his lawful wife Kenshoin.
She was born in Omi Province in 1580, as the eldest daughter of Kazutoyo YAMAUCHI and his lawful wife Kenshoin.

sen.j: 名は『一豊公紀』には「與禰」と伝わる。
sen.e: Her name is written as '與禰' in Japanese in the "Kazutoyo Koki" (The Public Records of Kazutoyo).
Her name is written as '與禰' in Japanese in the "Kazutoyo Koki" (The Public Records of Kazutoyo).
Her name is written as '與禰' in Japanese in the "Kazutoyo Koki" (The Public Records of Kazutoyo).

sen.j: 天正13年（1585年）に一豊が近江長浜城 (近江国)主となり、城内で暮らすが同年11月29日の天正大地震で城が全壊し、命を落とした。
sen.e: In 1585, Kazutoyo assumed the lord of Nagahama-jo Castle in Omi Province and she also stayed at this castle, but the castle was totally destroyed due to the Tensho Great Earthquake on January 18, 1586, and she died from this.
sen.cmt: 原文に「長浜城 (近江国)」とありますが、リンク先の用語と混ざっているようです。ウェブを確認し「長浜城」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: In 1585, Kazutoyo assumed the lord of Nagahama-jo Castle in Omi Province and she also stayed at this castle, but the castle was totally destroyed due to the Tensho Great Earthquake on January 18, 1586, and she died from this.

In 1585, Kazutoyo assumed the lord of Nagahama-jo Castle in Omi Province and she also stayed at this castle, but the castle was totally destroyed due to the Tensho Great Earthquake on January 18, 1586, and she died from this.
It is said she died at the age of six.
It is said she died at the age of six.
It is said she died at the age of six.

sen.j: このことについては『一豊公紀』には以下のように記載されている。
sen.e: The "Kazutoyo Koki" says about this as follows.
sen.cmt: 分割のルールに従い「以下のように記載されている」を追加し、以下引用文個所は一文ごとにかぎかっこを追加いたしました。
sen.e: The "Kazutoyo Koki" says about this as follows.
The "Kazutoyo Koki" says about this as follows.

sen.j: 「十一月二十九日 於江州長浜宇内、大地震。」
sen.e: A great earthquake occurred in Nagahama, Omi Province on November 29 (old lunar calendar).'
sen.cmt: 文章の引用ですので、ここでの日付は記載通りの日付（旧暦）で表記しました。また、文頭のシングルクォーテーションが文字列の記号として認識されて表示されないため、二重につけてあります。
sen.e: A great earthquake occurred in Nagahama, Omi Province on November 29 (old lunar calendar).'
A great earthquake occurred in Nagahama, Omi Province on November 29 (old lunar calendar).'

sen.j: 「山川転動裂壊家屋、顛潰長濱之御城殿崩、與禰姫様喪亡、御歳六歳。」
sen.e: Mountains and rivers were shaken and houses collapsed, and Princess Yone died at the age of six because Omi Nagahama-jo Castle was totally destroyed.'
sen.cmt: 文頭のシングルクォーテーションが文字列の記号として認識されて表示されないため、二重につけてあります。
sen.e: Mountains and rivers were shaken and houses collapsed, and Princess Yone died at the age of six because Omi Nagahama-jo Castle was totally destroyed.'
Mountains and rivers were shaken and houses collapsed, and Princess Yone died at the age of six because Omi Nagahama-jo Castle was totally destroyed.'
Her posthumous name is Kokeimyoenze (光景妙円是).
sen.cmt: 「光景妙円是」の正式な読み方が不明です。文頭のシングルクォーテーションが文字列の記号として認識されて表示されないため、二重につけてあります。
sen.e: Her posthumous name is Kokeimyoenze (光景妙円是).'
sen.cmt: クォーテーション追加
sen.e: Her posthumous name is Kokeimyoenze (光景妙円是).'
She was a daughter of Kenshoin.'
sen.cmt: 文頭のシングルクォーテーションが文字列の記号として認識されて表示されないため、二重につけてあります。
sen.e: She was a daughter of Kenshoin.'
She was a daughter of Kenshoin.'

sen.j: 「此時、御家人乾和信始数拾人死。」
sen.e: At that time, hundreds of people including a vassal named Kazunobu INUI died.'
sen.cmt: 文頭のシングルクォーテーションが文字列の記号として認識されて表示されないため、二重につけてあります。
sen.e: At that time, hundreds of people including a vassal named Kazunobu INUI died.'
At that time, hundreds of people including a vassal named Kazunobu INUI died.'
Her posthumous name is Kokeimyoenze (光景妙円是).
Her posthumous name is Kokeimyoenze (光景妙円是).
Her posthumous name is Kokeimyoenze (光景妙円是).
Her graveyard is at Daidoin, Myoshin-ji Temple.
Her graveyard is at Daidoin, Myoshin-ji Temple.
Her graveyard is at Daidoin, Myoshin-ji Temple.
